body: It will be in onnxruntime 1.12.  We haven't set a date for it yet.
This should already be updated in the master branch so you can get dev builds from https://test.pypi.org/project/ort-nightly/

issue.title: ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'transformers.hf_api'

repository.name: txtai
repository.description: ðŸ’¡ Build AI-powered semantic search applications

issue.body:
I feel like I'm going crazy, but on two seperate distros (Xubuntu 22.04 and now PopOS 22.04) I'm running into an issue that I didn't have before reinstalling today.

If I install via `pip install txtai[all]` or `[pipeline]`, after having gotten the latest version installed, it downgrades my version. When txtai is downgraded to 3.5.0, I run into this error:
```
    from txtai.embeddings import Embeddings
  File "/home/pathos/.local/lib/python3.10/site-packages/txtai/embeddings/__init__.py", line 5, in <module>
    from .base import Embeddings
  File "/home/pathos/.local/lib/python3.10/site-packages/txtai/embeddings/base.py", line 12, in <module>
    from ..scoring import ScoringFactory
  File "/home/pathos/.local/lib/python3.10/site-packages/txtai/scoring/__init__.py", line 5, in <module>
    from .base import Scoring
  File "/home/pathos/.local/lib/python3.10/site-packages/txtai/scoring/base.py", line 10, in <module>
    from ..pipeline.tokenizer import Tokenizer
  File "/home/pathos/.local/lib/python3.10/site-packages/txtai/pipeline/__init__.py", line 20, in <module>
    from .translation import Translation
  File "/home/pathos/.local/lib/python3.10/site-packages/txtai/pipeline/translation.py", line 15, in <module>
    from transformers.hf_api import HfApi
ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'transformers.hf_api'
```
And if I don't install this, and install the latest version with `pip install git+https://github.com/neuml/txtai` or by `git clone` and `pip install .`, this issue is fixed and I can run most of the txtai. HOWEVER, then when trying to use Textractor, I run into the follow error:
```
ImportError: Textractor pipeline is not available - install "pipeline" extra to enable
```
Which, going back to the beginning, if I install the pipeline extra, 4.5.0 gets uninstalled and 3.5.0 gets installed, and then the first issue crops up that I am unsure how to fix, because reinstalling transformers has done absolutely nothing on both distros now.

Also on the side, before reinstalling because of a bugged install(I tried to update PopOS 21.04 to 22.04 and I think it failed somewhere along the line for some reason, because it was very unstable afterwards and eventually failed entirely this morning.), it was working fantastically and I must say this is an incredible package.
```
+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| NVIDIA-SMI 510.68.02    Driver Version: 510.68.02    CUDA Version: 11.6     |
|-------------------------------+----------------------+----------------------+
| GPU  Name        Persistence-M| Bus-Id        Disp.A | Volatile Uncorr. ECC |
| Fan  Temp  Perf  Pwr:Usage/Cap|         Memory-Usage | GPU-Util  Compute M. |
|                               |                      |               MIG M. |
|===============================+======================+======================|
|   0  NVIDIA GeForce ...  Off  | 00000000:2D:00.0  On |                  N/A |
|  0%   53C    P0    55W / 260W |   1259MiB / 11264MiB |      5%      Default |
|                               |                      |                  N/A |
+-------------------------------+----------------------+----------------------+
```
`Python 3.10.4`

body: I have just installed ort-nightly on Python 3.10 under Windows 10 64 bits and it's importing, and it seems to work, though I can't get skl2onnx to install (because it tries to remove nightly and go to the previous stable). I'll be installing another environment for training and seeing if it works fine later on.

Okay, I got to test this a bit further. The summary is this:

- ort-nighly is already working under Python 3.10 on Windows, compiles and runs.
- skl2onnx doesn't want to acknowledge ort-nightly, and doesn't install under 3.10 because of the dependency that fails.

So I set up a Python 3.9 environment for training and converting to ONNX, which worked, I then I loaded that module under 3.10 with ort-nightly which also ran fine. So maybe not ideal yet, but it's working already, with the nightly.

Disclaimer: YMMV, I didn't get to test everything of the runtime, just a few scikit-learn models running on CPU.

body:
So there's 2 ways to get around this issue for now (while it does suck that is hasn't been released yet afaik).

$ curl -sSL https://bootstrap.pypa.io/get-pip.py -o get-pip.py
$ python3.9 get-pip.py

this installs pip for python 3.9 which is then accessible via pip3.9

The other option as mentioned previously-
$pip install ort-nightly

both seem to work (program dependant), and up to the user's preference.
